key_mistakes.reason: This move is an inaccuracy because it doesn't challenge the center immediately and allows White to develop a strong pawn center.
Exchanging pawns here allows Black to equalize the central pawn structure too easily. White could have maintained more pressure by advancing the pawn.
This blunder loses the queen for insufficient compensation, as White can capture the queen and maintain a winning position.
An unsound sacrifice that doesn't lead to a strong attack or material gain.
This move allows Black to easily blockade the pawn and target it later without real counterplay.

recommendations: Focus on controlling the center early in the opening to prevent opponent counterplay.
Avoid unnecessary pawn exchanges that give the opponent equal central control.
In the endgame, prioritize advancing your king and pawns together to create winning chances.
When ahead in material, simplify the position by exchanging pieces, not pawns.
